article.headline: Vermont 81, New Hampshire 67
article.story: BURLINGTON, Vt.(AP) -- Taylor Coppenrath scored 39 points as Vermont topped New Hampshire, 81-67, in America East men's basketball Monday night. The win gives the Catamounts the top seed in the upcoming America East Basketball Championship and clinches at least a share of the conference regular season title. Vermont (20-5, 15-1 America East) can win its first-ever outright championship with a win in one of the last two games. The Wildcats (8-17, 4-12) made several runs at Vermont but they could not contain Coppenrath, the nation's third leading scorer heading into the contest. Coppenrath went 16-for-23 from the floor and seven-for-11 from the foul line in equaling his season-high in scoring. For Vermont, T.J. Sorrentine added 21 points including five three-pointers. Germain Mopa Njila chipped in with a career-high six assists and 10 rebounds while freshman Josh Duell came off the bench with seven points and seven boards. New Hampshire had four players in double figures, led by Ben Sturgill with 21 points. Mike Christensen added 14, Craig Walls scored 12 and Blagov Janev had 10. Chris Vetrano delivered a game-high nine assists.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
